title: Please can you guys ID the "j'adore" font from dior
content:
Hi Guys,

Im new here and I might be jumping in two footed into abuse...  
never the less,

what font is used for the DIOR j' adore pictures.

it looks similar to arabic typesetting from my collection, but its not quiet right/

http://www.mimifroufrou.com/scentedsalamander/images/J'adore\_Dior\_dark.jpg

http://www.shinystyle.tv/J'adore%20by%20Dior.jpg

Thanks
author: Raoulx

comments.content: I can't get either of those links to work.

oops

there basically stright google searches and need to be added to the brower,  
i will link them properly.

[http://www.mimifroufrou.com/scentedsalamander/images/J’adore\_Dior\_dark.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103164505/http:/www.mimifroufrou.com/scentedsalamander/images/J%E2%80%99adore_Dior_dark.jpg)  
 [http://www.shinystyle.tv/J’adore%20by%20Dior.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103164505/http:/www.shinystyle.tv/J%E2%80%99adore%20by%20Dior.jpg)

hope this works

grrr :@

it can be found on google just searching j'adore :(

Your links fell victim to the smart quotes filter.  
 [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103164505/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18067): No spaces etc. in the file name.

Here are the pics:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103164505im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jadore_5622.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103164505im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jadore-dark_5840.jpg)

The Dior logo was once identified as a custom Cochin. "j'adore" looks to be based on Cochin as well.

- Lex
Thanks guys for both of your help :D
